title: Mastering Liquidswap
description: Learn how to use Liquidswap, the first decentralized exchange (DEX) on Aptos that allows you to swap tokens, provide liquidity, and earn rewards while helping secure the protocol.

tasks.title: Prepare for Trading
tasks.description: Add at least 0.1 APT to your wallet to prepare for DEX interactions

tasks.title: Liquidswap Basics
tasks.description: Understand the fundamental concepts of Liquidswap DEX
tasks.question: What AMM (Automated Market Maker) model does Liquidswap use?
options: Constant Product (x*y=k)
Stable Curve
Both Constant Product and Stable Curve
Order Book Model
tasks.correctAnswer: Both Constant Product and Stable Curve

tasks.title: Understanding Liquidity Pools
tasks.description: Learn about liquidity provision on Liquidswap
tasks.question: What do liquidity providers receive in return for adding liquidity?
options: Fixed APT rewards
Trading fees only
LP tokens representing their share of the pool
Governance rights only
tasks.correctAnswer: LP tokens representing their share of the pool

tasks.title: Trading Mechanics
tasks.description: Understanding how trading works on Liquidswap
tasks.question: What is slippage in the context of Liquidswap?
options: The fee paid to liquidity providers
The time delay between transaction submission and confirmation
The difference between expected and actual execution price
The minimum amount received in a swap
tasks.correctAnswer: The difference between expected and actual execution price

tasks.title: Pool Types
tasks.description: Learn about different pool types on Liquidswap
tasks.question: When would you use a Stable Curve pool instead of a Constant Product pool?
options: For pairs of tokens with wildly different values
For any token pair with high volatility
For pairs of stablecoins or similarly priced assets
For low liquidity tokens only
tasks.correctAnswer: For pairs of stablecoins or similarly priced assets

tasks.title: Impermanent Loss
tasks.description: Understand the risks of providing liquidity
tasks.question: What is impermanent loss in liquidity provision?
options: Transaction fees paid to validators
Value lost due to smart contract failures
The opportunity cost of not trading directly
The value difference between holding assets versus providing liquidity
tasks.correctAnswer: The value difference between holding assets versus providing liquidity

tasks.title: Liquidswap Architecture
tasks.description: Understanding how Liquidswap is implemented on Aptos
tasks.question: What programming language is Liquidswap built with?
options: Solidity
Rust
Move
TypeScript

tasks.title: Security Considerations
tasks.description: Learn about security best practices when using Liquidswap
tasks.question: What should you do before approving a transaction on Liquidswap?
options: Simply trust the interface and default settings
Check only the token symbols
Verify token addresses, amounts, and slippage settings
Only verify gas fees
tasks.correctAnswer: Verify token addresses, amounts, and slippage settings
